'''Glalie''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''オニゴーリ''' ''Onigohri'') is an {{type|Ice}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Snorunt}} starting at [[level]] 42. It is one of Snorunt's final forms, the other being {{p|Froslass}}. It can [[Mega Evolution|Mega Evolve]] into '''Mega Glalie''' using the [[Glalitite]].

==Biology==
Glalie is a spherical Pokémon that consists of a black rock core covered by ice. The icy covering has several holes and spaces across this Pokémon’s body. Blue eyes and a mouth with flat teeth are visible through three of these holes. There are two large, black, conical horns on either side of Glalie's head. 

Mega Glalie's jaw is dislocated because of the overwhelming energy, causing its mouth to extend to the length of its face. The lower jaw is all black except for two light-blue, conical, icy spikes. The pupils in Mega Glalie's eyes are now red instead of black. The horns on top Mega Glalie's head have been partially turned into ice, with the addition of a third horn on its forehead.

Glalie's icy body is actually rock that is not particularly hard. It does not melt, and it can control ice by instantly freezing moisture in the air into any desirable shape. This ability is used to drape itself in ice armor and freeze its prey, which it then consumes whole. It prefers consuming Pokémon like {{p|Vanillite}} that are already frozen though. It can be found in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Cave Pokémon|caves}}. Mega Glalie can spill endless blizzards from its broken mouth, though it gets irritated by the fact that it can no longer consume its prey.

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:PokéSled Glalie.png|thumb|220px|left|Glalie in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
[[File:M19 Mega Glalie.png|thumb|220px|left|Mega Glalie in the anime]]
====Major appearances====
=====[[Ash's Glalie]]=====
{{Ash}}'s {{p|Snorunt}} evolved into {{AP|Glalie}} in ''[[AG123|Rhapsody in Drew]]''. It only stayed during the [[Hoenn League]]. It is now at {{an|Professor Oak}}'s [[Professor Oak's Laboratory|lab]].

=====Other=====
A Glalie appeared in ''[[DP116|The Drifting Snorunt!]]'', under the ownership of a {{OBP|Poacher|DP116}}. The poacher used Glalie to assist in capturing a Snorunt, which it did by frightening it into submission. However, it was defeated by [[Ash's Chimchar]] and a wild {{p|Froslass}}.

A Glalie appeared in ''[[BW140|Survival of the Striaton Gym!]]'', under the ownership of [[Morana]]. Its appearance was during a flashback to when it was able to defeat [[Cress's Panpour]].

A Glalie that can Mega Evolve appeared in ''[[M19|Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel]]'', under the control of [[Levi]]'s Mega Wave. Glalie was used to battle against {{OBP|Volcanion|M19}}. It was later freed from Levi's control when [[Alva]]'s Mega Wave Crystal was destroyed, and it escaped.

====Minor appearances====
A Glalie appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M08|Lucario and the Mystery of Mew]]''.

A Glalie made a brief cameo in ''[[SS021|Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Sky - Beyond Time & Darkness]]''.

A Glalie that can [[Mega Evolution|Mega Evolve]] into Mega Glalie appeared in ''[[SS031|Mega Evolution Special II]]''.

A Trainer's Glalie appeared in [[SM060]], where it was seen participating in the [[PokéSled Jump Tournament]].

==In the manga==
[[File:Noland Glalie Adventures.png|thumb|150px|Glalie in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
In ''[[PS251|The Beginning of the End with Kyogre & Groudon XIII]]'', [[Glacia]] of the [[Hoenn]] [[Elite Four]] was seen in possession of a Glalie.

{{FB|Factory Head|Noland}} is seen picking a Glalie as one of his [[rental Pokémon]] in his battle against {{adv|Emerald}} in ''[[PS307|Gotcha Where I Wantcha, Glalie]]''. Although he came close to winning by delivering a would-be-fatal {{m|Sheer Cold}} that succeeded in hitting his target, [[Emerald's Sceptile]] was in fact, unbeknownst to both Noland and Emerald, not meant to be a rental Pokémon and survived due to his higher level. He eventually lost to Sceptile's {{m|Iron Tail}}, allowing Emerald to win the [[Symbol|Knowledge Symbol]].

A Glalie appeared in ''[[PS315|Skirting Around Surskit I]]'' as a rental Pokémon that [[Guile Hideout]] stole.

==Trivia==
* Glalie shares all of its base stats with {{p|Phione}}.

===Origin===
Similar to Jynx, Glalie is based on human features, most likely on a cold, distant person or facial expression. It also looks somewhat similar to an ice hockey mask. Due to its horns and teeth, it may be based on a standard {{wp|Oni (folklore)|oni}} or possibly even {{wp|onigiri}} ([[rice ball]]), as its Japanese name suggests. It also resembles a {{wp|hail}}stone.

====Name origin====
Glalie may be a combination of ''{{wp|glacier}}'' and ''{{wp|Goaltender|goalie}}''.

Onigohri is a combination of 鬼 ''{{wp|Oni (folklore)|oni}}'' (demon) and 氷 ''kōri'' (ice). It may also be a pun on ''{{wp|onigiri}}'', which it slightly resembles. ''Gohri'' also bears phonetic similarity to ''goalie''.
